meta_title: What is FIFO? First-In, First-Out Definition & Industrial Use
meta_description: FIFO (First-In, First-Out) is an inventory method where the oldest stock is used first. Optimize MRO inventory, reduce waste, and improve maintenance efficiency.
title: FIFO (First-In, First-Out) Definition

hero_image.alt: Hero image for FIFO (First-In, First-Out) Definition

image_prompt: A high-angle, photo-realistic shot of a modern, brightly lit industrial warehouse in 2026. A diverse team of maintenance professionals in high-visibility vests and hard hats are using tablets to manage organized shelving units. The shelves contain neatly labeled mechanical spare parts and high-tech components, showing a clear, color-coded flow of inventory. The atmosphere is clean, efficient, and technologically advanced, with a focus on precision and order.
